titleStmt.title: The miraculous fasting of the naked-man being a strange and true account how Mr. Joseph Wright, (who, for ten or twelve years last past, went naked through the streets of the city and suburbs of London) has liv'd in the Poultrey-Compter thirty five days without eating or drinking, notwithstanding he had lost twelve ounces of blood the day before his confinement.

notesStmt.note: Dated at end: Poultrey-Compter London, Octob. 8. 1700.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
